00059 #ifndef HEADER_ENGINE_INT_H
00060 #define HEADER_ENGINE_INT_H
00061 
00062 /* Take public definitions from engine.h */
00063 #include <openssl/engine.h>
00064 
00065 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00066 extern "C" {
00067 #endif
00068 
00069 /* If we compile with this symbol defined, then both reference counts in the
00070  * ENGINE structure will be monitored with a line of output on stderr for each
00071  * change. This prints the engine's pointer address (truncated to unsigned int),
00072  * "struct" or "funct" to indicate the reference type, the before and after
00073  * reference count, and the file:line-number pair. The "engine_ref_debug"
00074  * statements must come *after* the change. */
00075 #ifdef ENGINE_REF_COUNT_DEBUG
00076 
00077 #define engine_ref_debug(e, isfunct, diff) \
00078     fprintf(stderr, "engine: %08x %s from %d to %d (%s:%d)\n", \
00079         (unsigned int)(e), (isfunct ? "funct" : "struct"), \
00080         ((isfunct) ? ((e)->funct_ref - (diff)) : ((e)->struct_ref - (diff))), \
00081         ((isfunct) ? (e)->funct_ref : (e)->struct_ref), \
00082         (__FILE__), (__LINE__));
00083 
00084 #else
00085 
00086 #define engine_ref_debug(e, isfunct, diff)
00087 
00088 #endif
00089 
00090 /* Any code that will need cleanup operations should use these functions to
00091  * register callbacks. ENGINE_cleanup() will call all registered callbacks in
00092  * order. NB: both the "add" functions assume CRYPTO_LOCK_ENGINE to already be
00093  * held (in "write" mode). */
00094 typedef void (ENGINE_CLEANUP_CB)(void);
00095 typedef struct st_engine_cleanup_item
00096     {
00097     ENGINE_CLEANUP_CB *cb;
00098     } ENGINE_CLEANUP_ITEM;
00099 DECLARE_STACK_OF(ENGINE_CLEANUP_ITEM)
00100 void engine_cleanup_add_first(ENGINE_CLEANUP_CB *cb);
00101 void engine_cleanup_add_last(ENGINE_CLEANUP_CB *cb);
00102 
00103 /* We need stacks of ENGINEs for use in eng_table.c */
00104 DECLARE_STACK_OF(ENGINE)
00105 
00106 /* If this symbol is defined then engine_table_select(), the function that is
00107  * used by RSA, DSA (etc) code to select registered ENGINEs, cache defaults and
00108  * functional references (etc), will display debugging summaries to stderr. */
00109 /* #define ENGINE_TABLE_DEBUG */
00110 
00111 /* This represents an implementation table. Dependent code should instantiate it
00112  * as a (ENGINE_TABLE *) pointer value set initially to NULL. */
00113 typedef struct st_engine_table ENGINE_TABLE;
00114 int engine_table_register(ENGINE_TABLE **table, ENGINE_CLEANUP_CB *cleanup,
00115         ENGINE *e, const int *nids, int num_nids, int setdefault);
00116 void engine_table_unregister(ENGINE_TABLE **table, ENGINE *e);
00117 void engine_table_cleanup(ENGINE_TABLE **table);
00118 #ifndef ENGINE_TABLE_DEBUG
00119 ENGINE *engine_table_select(ENGINE_TABLE **table, int nid);
00120 #else
00121 ENGINE *engine_table_select_tmp(ENGINE_TABLE **table, int nid, const char *f, int l);
00122 #define engine_table_select(t,n) engine_table_select_tmp(t,n,__FILE__,__LINE__)
00123 #endif
00124 
00125 /* Internal versions of API functions that have control over locking. These are
00126  * used between C files when functionality needs to be shared but the caller may
00127  * already be controlling of the CRYPTO_LOCK_ENGINE lock. */
00128 int engine_unlocked_init(ENGINE *e);
00129 int engine_unlocked_finish(ENGINE *e, int unlock_for_handlers);
00130 int engine_free_util(ENGINE *e, int locked);
00131 
00132 /* This function will reset all "set"able values in an ENGINE to NULL. This
00133  * won't touch reference counts or ex_data, but is equivalent to calling all the
00134  * ENGINE_set_***() functions with a NULL value. */
00135 void engine_set_all_null(ENGINE *e);
00136 
00137 /* NB: Bitwise OR-able values for the "flags" variable in ENGINE are now exposed
00138  * in engine.h. */
00139 
00140 /* This is a structure for storing implementations of various crypto
00141  * algorithms and functions. */
00142 struct engine_st
00143     {
00144     const char *id;
00145     const char *name;
00146     const RSA_METHOD *rsa_meth;
00147     const DSA_METHOD *dsa_meth;
00148     const DH_METHOD *dh_meth;
00149     const RAND_METHOD *rand_meth;
00150     /* Cipher handling is via this callback */
00151     ENGINE_CIPHERS_PTR ciphers;
00152     /* Digest handling is via this callback */
00153     ENGINE_DIGESTS_PTR digests;
00154 
00155 
00156     ENGINE_GEN_INT_FUNC_PTR destroy;
00157 
00158     ENGINE_GEN_INT_FUNC_PTR init;
00159     ENGINE_GEN_INT_FUNC_PTR finish;
00160     ENGINE_CTRL_FUNC_PTR ctrl;
00161     ENGINE_LOAD_KEY_PTR load_privkey;
00162     ENGINE_LOAD_KEY_PTR load_pubkey;
00163 
00164     const ENGINE_CMD_DEFN *cmd_defns;
00165     int flags;
00166     /* reference count on the structure itself */
00167     int struct_ref;
00168     /* reference count on usability of the engine type. NB: This
00169      * controls the loading and initialisation of any functionlity
00170      * required by this engine, whereas the previous count is
00171      * simply to cope with (de)allocation of this structure. Hence,
00172      * running_ref <= struct_ref at all times. */
00173     int funct_ref;
00174     /* A place to store per-ENGINE data */
00175     CRYPTO_EX_DATA ex_data;
00176     /* Used to maintain the linked-list of engines. */
00177     struct engine_st *prev;
00178     struct engine_st *next;
00179     };
00180 
00181 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00182 }
00183 #endif
00184 
00185 #endif /* HEADER_ENGINE_INT_H */
